                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Miscellaneous research material and notes used for the book "The Tenor of his Time." 1890- 1969.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Includes 17 file cards (20.5 x 13 cm.) on E. Johnson as general manager of the Metropolitan Opera; 3 file cards with reminiscences by Mrs. Belmont and Francis Robinson; 7 file cards and loose notes with miscellaneous information. Also includes 5 file cards on early Guelph: reports on the concert by Robert Merrill, Guelph, Mar. 21, 1956, given by the Presto Club; reflections on E. Johnson's early life in Guelph; 1898 concert for the benefit of the Speed Canoe Club (owned by E. Johnson's uncle, William); genealogical information on E. Johnson's grandparents and other relatives (descendents of Coningsby and Martha Evans); Guelph Weekly Mercury article, Apr. 10, 1890, concerning the teaching of music by Mr. C. Crowe in the Central School; newspaper obituaries for Arthur Higinbotham (Sept. 16, 1955) and Flora MacLean Browett, who taught E. Johnson in primary grades at private school. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Guelph</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>

Also includes 5 file cards on early Guelph: reports on the concert by Robert Merrill, Guelph, Mar. 21, 1956, given by the Presto Club; reflections on E. Johnson's early life in Guelph; 1898 concert for the benefit of the Speed Canoe Club (owned by E. Johnson's uncle, William); genealogical information on E. Johnson's grandparents and other relatives (descendents of Coningsby and Martha Evans); Guelph Weekly Mercury article, Apr. 10, 1890, concerning the teaching of music by Mr. C. Crowe in the Central School; newspaper obituaries for Arthur Higinbotham (Sept. 16, 1955) and Flora MacLean Browett, who taught E. Johnson in primary grades at private school.
resource.displayEntry: Ruby Mercer Collection. Miscellaneous research material and notes used for the book "The Tenor of his Time."

resourceRelations.content: Ruby Mercer Collection. Miscellaneous research material and notes used for the book "The Tenor of his Time."

Johnson, 1941; letters from Estelle Maxwell to Edward Johnson, 1940-1944; an incomplete letter presumably from Fiorenza Drew to Mr. Wadmond of the Metropolitan Opera Club, 1959; a letter from Fiorenza Drew to Mr. Lauterstein re a tribute to her late father by the Metropolitan Opera Association, 1959. </abstract>

                     <title>Miscellaneous collection of programs, speeches, clippings and articles relating chiefly to Edward Johnson and the founding of the Edward Johnson Music Foundation and Guelph Spring Festival. 1897-</title>

                  <abstract>Includes texts of talks by Roberston Davies, Murdo MacKinnon, Nicholas Goldschmidt, Judith Colbert, Walter Pitman, Marilyn Crooks and Lou Applebaum; also a file on the biography on Edward Johnson, including letters from E. Johnson and other opera singers as part of the Canada Post opera series, Oct. 17, 2006 (first day cover and souvenir sheet).
